titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, projects, SG 1.40 (A2015) FA761

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-01-01 05:02:23 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Records have received basic level 1 processing to establish initial intellectual and physical control of the holdings. Materials remain in original record cartons and folders.
This guide provides file level description. Each file may represent multiple folders.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Project files transferred to the RAC by Rockefeller Foundation, 2015.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records are primarily arranged by Program.
Records are arranged as received. Within folders, materials are primarily arranged in reverse chronological order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records 10 years old and older are open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact a RAC archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Foundation has title, copyright and literary and intellectual property rights to the records, in so far as it holds them. Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission cite and publish materiaFord Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Special Formats (audio, film, video, digital media, library materials, memorabilia, oversize, and photographic material) have been separated from the body of the collection. All pertinent items are assigned a unique separation number, as noted. Requests to access open special formats should reference the unique separation number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant administration files and related material.
